You‚Äôre right. If one factor in the opportunity cost of that $500 step up  the eir actually drops below 4.6% for ocbc360. In theory  that $500 can earn higher than 0.5% (e.g 2.7%) elsewhere.Also to consider is that the step up mechanism requires a reset at certain intervals (e.g yearly). So 1 mth will not earn that 1.5% which will also reduces the eir. Same reason why tbill hv to be above 3.3% to be feasible for one to use cpf. Ignoring the oppt cost factor above  a 24mth reset interval already also drop the eir below 4.6%. So likely 4.65% is only theoretical.I‚Äôm simply assuming we max $100k base n one can meet all requirements. One probably has to consider many factors to decide which is better. No straight answer one la‚Ä¶
